content.description: Stand start, match on the slopey ledge, pull up, and mantel...work out your topouts, bro.
content.location:
Go around the boulder to the left of

Ninja Boots

or to the right of

Bearded Clam

.It is on the backside of the boulder if you are facing the boulder from the trail.

content.description: Stand start with a small crimp for your left hand and a right hand sloper. Do a hard smear, and slowly move up to better holds. This is another problem, if done poorly, will feel waaaay harder than it seems...get better footwork.
content.location: This is the frst climb you run into when you hit the Fupa Boulder.

content.description:
Stand start with your right hand on a good protruding edge and your left hand on a angled pinch. Move your feet up, and use the angled seam to go up and left. This tops out the same as

Gunt

.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Gunt

.

content.description: Sit start, move up and right to a small crimp with your right hand, then shoot your left hand to the lip, and mantel.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Snatch

.

content.description:
Stand start using the start as

Beaver Flop

, but move up and right. Reach up over your head with your left hand to a good edge, then move out right to a good right hand pinch. Then pop your right hand out to the arete lip, match, and then go for the mostly featureless, beached whale, grovel topout. There is a bad boulder below that would ruin you if you were to fall on it with your back, so pad it up, and have a good attentive spotter.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Beaver Flop

.

content.description: Stand start with both of your hands matched on the arete, and move up and left to some slopey edges and slopers.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Moose Knuckle

or to the left of

Ninja Boots

.

content.description: Stand start with both of your hands in the horizontal crack, and move left to a good, slopey edge with your left hand, then bump out slightly right to a good edge, match, toss your left heel where your left hand was, and pull up. A good sidepull awaits you at the top for your left hand.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Ninja Boots

and starts under the roof on the best holds.

content.description: Stand start, match on the protruding edge, and move up with slopers and slopey edges with good feet.
